author: .funnyking
content:
There is one thing that is not clear to me in this channel, namely whether the issue of ethereum scaling and the very high cost of gas is experienced as an urgent problem to be addressed or not. 
Let me explain better, the EIP 2929 appears to me as a temporary fix to allow the current clients in production, geth included, to handle a higher load intended as gas x block, it is not an optimal solution because the current ethereum clients are not even close to an efficient fronteer.
However, even if EIP 2929 is not the ideal solution to scale ethereum, it is fast, with few risks, easy to implement (at least reading the draft on github it seems to be so) and has the advantage to be 
canceled in the future to return to the previous situation. You can eventually delete it when the main ethereum clients are more efficient and do not have to fear certain types of malicious attacks.
